definitions: person who studies or specializes in the formal principles of reasoning and logical thinking
examples: The logician pointed out several flaws in the argument
Famous logicians like Aristotle shaped how we understand reasoning

definitions: visual design or symbol that represents a company, organization, or brand
examples: The company redesigned their logo to look more modern
Every product package displays the manufacturer's logo prominently

definitions: lower back area between the ribs and hips on either side of the spine
tender cut of meat from the back area of an animal
examples: The athlete felt pain in his left loin after lifting
He wrapped a towel around his loins after the shower
The restaurant serves excellent pork loin with vegetables
She ordered the grilled lamb loin for dinner tonight

definitions: simple cloth worn around the hips and groin area as basic clothing
examples: Ancient warriors often wore only a loincloth in battle
The traditional costume included a decorated loincloth and headdress

definitions: hard candy mounted on a stick designed to be licked or sucked
examples: The doctor gave the child a lollipop after the checkup
Cherry and grape are popular lollipop flavors at the store

definitions: informal term for lollipop or hard candy on a stick
frozen juice or ice cream on a stick eaten as dessert
examples: She bought a bag of fruit lollies from the shop
The children enjoyed their lollies at the birthday party
We made homemade ice lollies using fresh fruit juice
Orange lollies are perfect for hot summer days outside

definitions: person who prefers to be alone and avoids the company of others
examples: The artist was known as a loner who rarely attended social events
Being a loner doesn't necessarily mean being lonely or unhappy

definitions: tall wooden bow drawn by hand used historically in hunting and warfare
examples: Medieval English archers were famous for their skill with the longbow
The museum displayed a six-foot longbow from the fifteenth century

definitions: someone who yearns or has a strong desire for something distant or unattainable
examples: She was a longer for adventure in distant lands
The poet described himself as a longer for simpler times

definitions: length of time that something or someone lives or exists, especially great duration
examples: Regular exercise and healthy eating can increase your longevity significantly
The company's longevity is due to its ability to adapt

definitions: breed of cattle with distinctive long curved horns originally from Texas
examples: The ranch specializes in raising Texas longhorn cattle for breeding
A massive longhorn stood grazing peacefully in the pasture field

definitions: strong persistent yearning or desire especially for something unattainable or distant
examples: She felt a deep longing to see her homeland again
His longing for adventure led him to travel the world

definitions: angular distance east or west from the prime meridian measured in degrees
examples: Ships use longitude and latitude to navigate across the oceans
The city is located at 74 degrees west longitude precisely

definitions: competitor or attempt that has very little chance of winning or succeeding
examples: Betting on that horse is a real longshot but could pay well
Getting the promotion was a longshot but she decided to try

definitions: informal British term for toilet or bathroom used for waste elimination
examples: Excuse me, could you tell me where the loo is located
There was a long queue for the loo during the intermission

definitions: action of directing one's eyes to see or search for something
outward appearance or attractiveness of a person or thing
examples: Looking for her keys took up most of the morning
The looking process requires patience when searching for rare items
She has the fresh looking of someone who exercises regularly
The old building still maintains its distinguished looking despite age

definitions: elevated position or structure used for keeping watch over an area
person assigned to keep watch for danger or approaching people
examples: The fire lookout tower provides views for miles around
Ships use the crow's nest as a lookout during voyages
The gang posted a lookout while they robbed the store
Border guards serve as lookouts for illegal crossing attempts daily

definitions: act of searching for and finding information in a reference source
examples: The dictionary lookup revealed the word had multiple meanings entirely
Database lookups can slow down if not properly indexed correctly

definitions: device or machine used for weaving cloth from threads or yarn
examples: The antique loom still produces beautiful handwoven fabrics today successfully
She learned to operate the loom at the textile factory

definitions: large diving bird with distinctive call found in northern lakes
informal term for someone who behaves in a silly or crazy way
examples: The haunting call of a loon echoed across the lake
Loons dive deep underwater to catch fish for their meals
Don't mind him, he's a bit of a loon sometimes
That loon at the party was dancing on the tables again

definitions: informal term for someone who acts foolishly or appears mentally unstable
examples: The old looney down the street talks to imaginary friends
Don't be such a looney and think before you act

definitions: informal term for someone considered silly, eccentric, or mentally unstable
examples: That loony idea might actually work if we try it
The comedy show featured a character who was a lovable loony

definitions: caterpillar that moves by arching its body into loops while crawling
person or device that creates loops in thread, wire, or other materials
examples: The looper caterpillar inched along the branch in characteristic fashion
Garden loopers can damage vegetable plants if not controlled properly
The sewing machine's looper creates the bottom thread loops perfectly
She worked as a looper in the textile factory for years

definitions: ambiguity or gap in rules or laws that allows circumvention of requirements
examples: Lawyers found a tax loophole that saved their client thousands
The contract had a loophole that allowed early termination easily

definitions: action of forming or moving in loops or circular patterns repeatedly
examples: The plane's looping stunts thrilled the airshow audience watching below
The roller coaster's looping section is the most exciting part

definitions: process of making something less tight, firm, or restrictive than before
examples: The loosening of regulations allowed more businesses to open
Regular loosening of soil helps plants grow better in gardens

definitions: goods or money obtained illegally especially by stealing or plundering
examples: Pirates buried their loot on remote islands for safekeeping later
The thieves divided the loot among themselves after the heist

definitions: act of stealing goods especially during riots, disasters, or social unrest
examples: Looting broke out after the hurricane destroyed the shopping district
The army was deployed to prevent looting during the blackout

definitions: easy, bounding way of running with long relaxed strides
examples: The horse moved at a gentle lope across the meadow
Wolves can maintain a steady lope for hours while hunting

definitions: title used when addressing or referring to a lord or judge
territory under the control of a lord or the state of being a lord
examples: Your Lordship, the defendant wishes to address the court now
His Lordship will see you in his chambers this afternoon
The lordship included three villages and extensive farmland around them
He inherited both the title and lordship from his father

definitions: body of traditions and knowledge passed down through generations about a subject
examples: Ancient lore tells of dragons living in these mountains long ago
Medical lore from indigenous peoples often contains valuable remedies today

definitions: British term for a large motor vehicle used for transporting goods
examples: The lorry delivered building materials to the construction site today
Heavy lorries are restricted from using this narrow country road

definitions: smooth liquid preparation applied to skin for medicinal or cosmetic purposes
examples: She applied suntan lotion before going to the beach today
The dry skin lotion helped relieve his itching and discomfort

definitions: system of raising money by selling numbered tickets and giving prizes to holders of numbers drawn at random
examples: She won ten thousand dollars in the state lottery last week
Playing the lottery regularly doesn't increase your chances of winning

definitions: game of chance where players select numbers hoping to match those drawn
examples: He plays the same lotto numbers every week without fail
The lotto jackpot has grown to fifty million dollars this week

definitions: device that converts electrical signals into sounds loud enough to be heard at a distance
examples: The announcement came over the loudspeaker in the train station
Concert loudspeakers must be positioned carefully for optimal sound quality

definitions: Irish or Scottish Gaelic word for lake or sea inlet
examples: Lough Neagh is the largest lake in the British Isles
The small village sits beside a peaceful lough in County Cork

definitions: comfortable room in a house for relaxing and socializing informally
public room in hotels or airports where people can wait or relax
examples: The family gathered in the lounge to watch television together
Their house has a spacious lounge with comfortable leather furniture
Business class passengers have access to the executive lounge facilities
The hotel lounge serves drinks and light snacks until midnight

definitions: small wingless parasitic insect that lives on warm-blooded animals
informal term for a mean, unpleasant, or contemptible person
examples: Head lice spread quickly among children in schools and daycare
A single louse can lay hundreds of eggs during its lifetime
Don't trust him, he's a real louse who betrays friends
That louse still owes me money from five years ago

definitions: angled slat designed to admit light and air while keeping out rain
famous art museum in Paris housing works like the Mona Lisa
examples: The louvre windows provide ventilation without letting rain inside
Wooden louvres can be adjusted to control the amount of light
The Louvre attracts millions of visitors from around the world annually
She spent hours exploring the ancient artifacts at the Louvre

definitions: small form of letters as opposed to capital or uppercase letters
examples: Please write your password using both uppercase and lowercase letters
The editor changed all the headings from uppercase to lowercase

definitions: act of moving something to a lower position or reducing its level
examples: The lowering of interest rates stimulated economic growth last quarter
The crane operator began lowering the heavy beam into place

definitions: area of land that is low in relation to surrounding countryside
examples: Rice grows well in the fertile lowland regions near rivers
The Scottish Lowlands contrast sharply with the mountainous Highlands region

definitions: salmon fillet that has been cured in brine and sometimes smoked
examples: She ordered a bagel with lox and cream cheese for breakfast
The deli serves the finest lox imported from Scotland weekly

definitions: person who remains loyal to established authority especially during revolt or change
examples: The king rewarded loyalists who supported him during the rebellion
Party loyalists defended the leader despite mounting criticism from others
